If you accidentally stopped the process of transferring the account to the new device, you'll loose all your settings and chats. It is not possible to initiate the transfer again. Onece the qr code scanned, there's no way back. If you found that there's no backup of your chats, bye-bye, you can't backup on the old device and try transferring the account again. ğŸ’© Moreover, it's not possible to create a new qr code because the old line app is immediately blocked.

I contacted LINE and they acknowledged that I wouldn't be able to log in without even saying why.

The Line app leaves much to be desired when it comes to preserving communication. It has a habit of treating messages, images, and other content like temporary guests, promptly showing them the door shortly after their arrival. This can be frustrating for users who would like their interactions to have a bit more permanence. Nonetheless, it does have its redeeming qualities. The app is particularly popular for its wide range of stickers, a feature that has garnered it a significant user base in

I like many things about Line, but many people I know have been burned when trying to transfer an account to a new device. Many have lost their account and had to start new. Do NOT trust the app to guide you through a transfer! Read carefully online first, find a good step by step guide (Line's own information is sketchy), make backups of EVERYTHING, and follow all the steps exactly. Line does not properly warn you before you start on steps that cannot be undone, and you risk losing everything.
